SEARCH
Package signal

Class Signal

java.lang.Object
signal.Signal
public class Signal extends Object

This class functions similarly to a Godot Signal.

When creating a new signal, you specify parameters that define the types of methods that can be connected. For example, if you create a signal with a single String parameter, you cannot connect a method that expects an Integer parameter.

When the signal is emitted, all connected methods are triggered with the parameters provided by the emit function.

Note that connected methods cannot return any values.

Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Signal

      public Signal(Class<?>... parameters)
      Constructs a Signal with specified parameter types for methods that will be connected to it.
      Parameters:
      parameters - the types of parameters that connected methods should accept; each can be any class type, but primitive types are not allowed. To specify a class type, use YourClass.class.
      Since:
      1.0

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public void connect(Object object_instance, String method_name) throws IllegalAccessException, InvalidConnectionException, InvalidMethodNameException, InvalidMethodParametreException
      Connects a method of a specific instance object to the Signal. The same method of an object cannot be connected more than once.
      Parameters:
      object_instance - the instance of the object to connect
      method_name - the name of the method to connect
      Since:
      1.0

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect(Object object_instance, String method_name) throws InvalidConnectionException
      Disconnects the method of a specific instance object from the Signal.
      Parameters:
      object_instance - the instance of the object to disconnect
      method_name - the name of the method to disconnect
      Throws:
      InvalidConnectionException - if the method of the instance object is not connected
      Since:
      1.0

    • disconnectAll

      public void disconnectAll()
      Disconnects all methods from the Signal.
      Since:
      1.0

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected(Object object_instance, String method_name)
      Checks if the specified method of the given instance object is connected to the Signal.
      Parameters:
      object_instance - the instance of the object
      method_name - the name of the method
      Returns:
      true if the method is connected; false otherwise
      Since:
      1.0

    • getConnections

      public ArrayList<HashMap<String,Object>> getConnections()
      Returns an ArrayList of HashMap objects, each containing two entries with keys "Object" and "Method". The "Object" entry represents the connected object, and the "Method" entry represents the connected method.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of HashMap objects, where each HashMap contains an "Object" and a "Method"
      Since:
      1.1

    • emit

      public void emit(Object... parameters) throws InvalidMethodParametreException, IllegalAccessException
      Emits the Signal and triggers all connected methods.
      Parameters:
      parameters - the parameters that will be passed to all connected methods
      Since:
      1.0
